intro: Ammannia purpurea, commonly known as purple ammannia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant features upright stems that are often reddish-purple in color, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a distinctive reddish or purple hue on the underside. Ammannia purpurea is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
